column4: working in a terminal... I get used to have .c files that were colored back.. since installation of the backup data they're now green - the color of .exe... how can I change them to black ?
tak a look at them with ls -l ; if the execute bit is set (an x in permissions) chmod -x *.c will fix it
how do I get rid of the same color for text files?
nm, vic secret
the chmod command works for any file; that execute bit it mentioned earlier can be on any file. Just -x the files you want.
also, linux looks at the file directly to figure out what it is, it does not use the extensions to figure it out
you could try aptitude search ^gstreamer , and install anything not installed
